did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Acc. 2009.343 contains contact sheets created by Jim Gleason pertaining to events and activities at the College of William and Mary from 1985-2006.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Research Center, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: C. James Gleason Photographs, Special Collections Research Center, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were acquired by Special Collections Research Center from Mary Gleason on 09/26/2008.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Gleason served as College of William and Mary photographer for two decades photographing events, people, locations, etc. related to the University. The native of Cleveland, Ohio, died July 5, 2006, two months after he received the Prentis Award for service to the College and the community. An Air Force veteran, he taught photojournalism at Kent State and Rochester Institute of Technology.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Acc. 2009.343 contains contact sheets created by Jim Gleason pertaining to events and activities at the College of William and Mary from 1985-2006.

The collection of James Gleason represents all aspects of events and activities at the College of William and Mary for the years 1983-2006. Events documented include: Charter Day, commencement, buildings, personnel, students, and athletics. Physically the collection is organized by the "rolls of film taken" and into years they were taken. They are stored and protected in plastic sheets in notebooks and numbered for identification.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.
